CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: BIA01

TI_TEXT.P: Строителни и монтажни работи на релсови пътища
Lucrări de construcţii de căi ferate

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Joint stock company for public railway infrastructure management: “Serbian Railways Infrastructure” JSC

LEGAL_BASIS_OTHER.P: The Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Serbia has requested the European Investment Bank (EIB) to provide financing for the Belgrade – Nis Railway Project. Serbian Railways Infrastructure JSC expects this contract to be financed by the EIB and be subject to the EIB's Guide to Procurement

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Joint stock company for public railway infrastructure management: “Serbian Railways Infrastructure” JSC

TITLE.P: Reconstruction and Modernization of Existing Railway Line and Construction of the Second Track Railway Belgrade — Nis, Section Stalac — Dunis

SHORT_DESCR.P: Reconstruction and modernization of existing railway line and construction of the second track railway Belgrade — Nis, section Stalac — Dunis implemented in accordance with FIDIC Contract Conditions for ‘Plant and Design-Build’ (‘Yellow Book’).

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: Lot 1 — Tunnelling and civil works for Tunnel no 4 on Stalac-Dunis section;
Lot 2 — Reconstruction and modernization of existing railway line and construction of the second track railway Belgrade — Nis, section Stalac — Dunis.

TITLE.P: Tunnelling and Civil Works for Tunnel Number 4 on Stalac-Dunis Section

MAIN_SITE.P: The contract will be performed in the Republic of Serbia, in the Resina District of central Serbia in the municipality of the city Cicevac.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Scope of the procurement includes design-build activities for tunnelling and civil works for Tunnel number 4 on Stalac-Dunis section. The total length of the tunnel no 4 is 3275 m and will be consisted (but not limited to) of the following main activities:
— preparation of design documentation in accordance with the Serbian regulations,
— tunnelling and construction of the new single tube, double-track rail tunnel located on the 182+325.00 km of the Belgrade-Nis railway line,
— construction of the tunnel using the NATM design and construction method,
— construction of the three Emergency Exit shafts with two exist points on each side of the railway,
— the scope of works includes all the necessary tunnelling and civil works, but not electrification, signalling and telecommunication which are part of Lot 2.

TITLE.P: Reconstruction and Modernization of Existing Railway Line and Construction of the second Track Railway Belgrade — Nis, Section Stalac — Dunis

MAIN_SITE.P: The contract will be performed in the Republic of Serbia, in the Resina District of central Serbia in the municipality of the city Cicevac and Krusevac.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Scope of the procurement includes design-build activities for reconstruction and modernization of existing railway line and construction of the second track railway Belgrade — Nis, section Stalac — Dunis. The total length of the of the line is 17.77 km of a double-track railway and will be consisted (but not limited to) of the following main activities:
— preparation of design documentation in accordance with the Serbian regulations,
— reconstruction of the exiting railway track and construction of the second railway track for a maximum designed speed of 160 km/h,
— construction of the tunnels 1, 2, 3 and 5 using the NATM design and construction method,
— construction of the emergency exit shafts for tunnel number 1 with two exist points on each side of the railway,
— the scope of works includes all the necessary tunnelling and civil works, electrification, signalling and telecommunication.

INFO_ADD.P: National authorisation (licencing) for construction works and designing is a legal requirement in Serbia, and has to be complied with at the time of the contract signature (it is not a condition for participating in tender and getting the contract awarded).

• Regulation (EU) No 236/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 March 2014 laying down common rules and procedures for the implementation of the Union's instruments for financing external action.
• Decision No 466 / 2014 / EU, published in the Official Journal of the EU, No L 135 of 8 May 2014.
• Works will be implemented in accordance with FIDIC Contract Conditions for ‘Plant and Design-Build’ (‘Yellow Book’).
